alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 23 at 3:42AM HST until December 24 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... .Overlapping northwest swells will maintain elevated surf into the weekend. As the current northwest (330 degrees) swell fades, a new, large northwest (310 degrees) swell will fill in today and peak tonight, maintaining advisory level surf conditions. Yet another similarly-sized northwest swell (310 degrees) is anticipated over the weekend, which will likely require a further extension of the advisory. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf building to 18 to 22 feet along north facing shores and 12 to 16 feet along west facing shores today, lowering slightly on Saturday. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
